text: VHA DIRECTIVE  1605
label: BODY

text: Veterans Health Administration
label: HH2

text: Transmittal Sheet
label: BODY

text: Washington, DC  20420
label: HH2

text: March 17, 2005
label: HH1

text: VHA PRIVACY PROGRAM
label: HH3

text: 1.  REASON FOR ISSUE.  This Veterans Health Administration (VHA) Directive establishes
label: HH1

text: a VHA-wide program for the protection of the privacy of veterans, their dependents, and
label: BODY

text: beneficiaries in accordance with Federal privacy statutes and regulations, as well as establishes
label: BODY

text: privacy policies to comply with the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Directive 6502.
label: BODY

text: 2.  SUMMARY OF CONTENTS/MAJOR CHANGES.  This VHA Directive sets forth:
label: HH1

text: a.  Policy for the VHA Privacy Program. This policy requires VA-wide compliance with all
label: BODY

text: applicable privacy laws, regulations, Executive Orders and implementation policies, guidance,
label: BODY

text: directives, and handbooks.
label: BODY

text: b.  Provision of the Freedom of Information Act, Privacy Act, Title 38 United States Code
label: BODY

text: (U.S.C.) (U.S.C. Sections 5701, 5705, 7332), and Standard of Privacy of Individually-
label: BODY

text: Identifiable Health Information, 45 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Parts 160 and 164, hence
label: BODY

text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Privacy Rule.
label: BODY

text: c.  Responsibilities for implementing and managing the VHA-wide Privacy Program; and
label: BODY

text: d.  References related to the VHA Privacy Program.
label: BODY

text: 3.  RELATED HANDBOOKS.  VHA Handbook 1605.1 and VHA Handbook 1605.2.
label: HH1

text: 4.  RESPONSIBLE OFFICE.  The VHA Office of Health Data and Informatics (19F) is
label: HH1

text: responsible for the contents of this Directive.  Questions may be referred to the VHA Privacy
label: BODY

text: Officer at 727-320-1839.
label: BODY

text: 5.  RESCISSIONS.  None.
label: HH1

text: 6.  RECERTIFICATION.  This VHA Directive is scheduled for recertification on or before the
label: HH1

text: last day of March 2010.
label: BODY

text: S/ Jonathan Perlin, MD, PhD, MSHA, FACP
label: BODY

text: Acting Under Secretary for Health
label: BODY

text: E-mailed 3/22/2005
label: BODY

text: VISN, MA, DO, OC, OCRO, and 200 – E-mailed 3/22/2005
label: BODY

text: March 17, 2005
label: HH1

text: VHA DIRECTIVE 1605
label: HH1

text: VHA PRIVACY PROGRAM
label: HH3

text: 1.  PURPOSE: This VHA Directive provides policy and responsibilities for the VHA Privacy
label: HH1

text: Program; and covers the responsibilities and requirements for compliance with all Federal
label: BODY

text: confidentiality laws and regulations.
label: BODY

text: 2.  BACKGROUND: The VHA Privacy Program applies to:
label: HH1

text: a.  Personal data that identifies an individual (herein referred to as “individually-identifiable
label: BODY

text: information”) that is collected, created, transmitted, used, processed, stored, or disposed of by or
label: BODY

text: for VHA; and
label: BODY

text: b.  VHA components pertaining to all individually-identifiable information, which is
label: BODY

text: maintained in any medium, including hard copy, microfilm, and electronic format and by
label: BODY

text: information systems administrated by, or otherwise under the authority or control of, the
label: BODY

text: Department of Veterans Affairs (VA).
label: BODY

text: 3.  POLICY:  It is VHA policy that a VHA-wide Privacy Program be implemented through the
label: H1

text: VHA Privacy Office in the Office of Health Data and Informatics.
label: BODY

text: 4.  RESPONSIBILITIES
label: HH1

text: a.  VHA Chief Health Informatics Officer (CHIO). The VHA CHIO is responsible for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Ensuring that Department-wide privacy policies and procedures are implemented
label: BODY

text: through the VHA Privacy Program; and
label: BODY

text: (2)  Seeking technical guidance and requirements for the protection of all privacy–protected
label: BODY

text: data from the VA Privacy Service for the development and approval of cyber security
label: BODY

text: acquisitions, budgeting, and funding.
label: BODY

text: b.  VHA Privacy Officer.  The VHA Privacy Officer is responsible for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Performing all privacy duties and responsibilities as designated by the VA Privacy
label: BODY

text: Service and VHA CHIO;
label: BODY

text: (2)  Developing and implementing a VHA Privacy Program;
label: BODY

text: (3)  Developing, issuing, reviewing, and coordinating privacy policy for VHA in conjunction
label: BODY

text: with policy efforts by VA;
label: BODY

text: (4)  Coordinating requirements and monitoring compliance with all Federal privacy law,
label: BODY

text: regulations, and guidance with VHA;
label: BODY

text: (5)  Issuing direction to facility-level Privacy Officers regarding all aspects of implementing
label: BODY

text: the VHA Privacy Program;
label: BODY

text: VHA DIRECTIVE 1605
label: HH1

text: March 17, 2005
label: HH1

text: (6)  Establishing requirements for the responsibilities of facility-level Privacy Officers and
label: BODY

text: providing implementation guidance, as needed;
label: BODY

text: (7)  Providing VHA-specific privacy training tools and periodically monitoring compliance
label: BODY

text: with the annual training requirement;
label: BODY

text: (8)  Examining new or pending legislation, in conjunction with the Office of General
label: BODY

text: Counsel, to determine the actual or potential impact of such legislation on privacy policy and/or
label: BODY

text: practice at VHA;
label: BODY

text: (9)  Establishing VHA policy on the reporting, tracking, resolution, and auditing of VHA
label: BODY

text: privacy violations and complaints;
label: BODY

text: (10)  Ensuring VHA resolves all privacy breaches in a timely fashion and in accordance with
label: BODY

text: applicable law;
label: BODY

text: (11)  Reporting all actual or suspected breaches of privacy of individually-identifiable
label: BODY

text: information observed or received at the national level to the tracking service designated by the
label: BODY

text: VA Privacy Service;
label: BODY

text: (12)  Coordinating investigation of and response to privacy complaints received from the
label: BODY

text: Department of Health and Human Services, Office of Civil Rights;
label: BODY

text: (13)  Maintaining a Notice of Privacy Practices; and
label: BODY

text: (14)  Providing expert guidance to the field in regard to the Privacy Act, Title 38 United
label: BODY

text: States Code (U.S.C.) Sections 5701 and 7332, Health Insurance Portability and Accountability
label: BODY

text: Act (HIPAA) Privacy Rule, and other applicable Federal privacy laws.
label: BODY

text: c.  Veterans Integrated Service Network (VISN) Director and Chief Program Officers.
label: BODY

text: The VISN Directors and Chief Program Officers are responsible for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Ensuring compliance within their respective programs with all Federal laws, regulations,
label: BODY

text: VA regulation and policies, and VHA policies relating to privacy;
label: BODY

text: (2)  Ensuring that all personnel within their respective programs attend annual privacy
label: BODY

text: training in accordance with applicable requirements and VHA privacy policy;
label: BODY

text: (3)  Ensuring that all personnel within their respective programs attend privacy training
label: BODY

text: before they are granted access to any individually–identifiable information, and that personnel
label: BODY

text: receive the follow-up privacy training periodically;
label: BODY

text: (4)  Implementing the requirements of the VHA Privacy Program; and
label: BODY

text: (5)  Designating an individual to provide guidance and oversight to ensure compliance with
label: BODY

text: privacy regulations for their respective programs.
label: BODY

text: March 17, 2005
label: HH1

text: VHA DIRECTIVE 1605
label: HH1

text: d.  Medical Center Director.  The Medical Center Director is responsible for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Ensuring there is a Privacy Officer at the facility; and
label: BODY

text: (2)  Ensuring facility policies and procedures consistent with polices contained in this
label: BODY

text: Directive are established and distributed to all employees.
label: BODY

text: e.  Privacy Officer. The Privacy Officer is assigned responsibility for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Developing facility privacy policies consistent with national privacy policies and
label: BODY

text: monitoring compliance with such privacy policies;
label: BODY

text: (2)  Reviewing or auditing all programs at the facility on a periodic basis to determine which
label: BODY

text: programs collect, maintain, and store individually-identifiable information in order to ensure
label: BODY

text: compliance with facility privacy policies;
label: BODY

text: (3)  Reporting, in a timely manner, all actual or suspected breaches of privacy of all
label: BODY

text: individually-identifiable information to the tracking service designated by the VA Privacy
label: BODY

text: Service; and
label: BODY

text: (4)  Providing expert guidance to the facility on all privacy related matters such as Privacy
label: BODY

text: Act (PA), Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), HIPAA and 38 U.S.C.
label: BODY

text: f.  VHA Personnel.  All VHA personnel are responsible for:
label: BODY

text: (1)  Complying with all Federal laws and regulations, VA regulations and policies, and VHA
label: BODY

text: policies relating to privacy;
label: BODY

text: (2)  Completing privacy training at the time of employment, annually thereafter, and within 6
label: BODY

text: months of a significant change in Federal law and regulation or VHA privacy policy;
label: BODY

text: (3)  Reporting all actual or suspected breaches of privacy in a timely and complete manner to
label: BODY

text: the appropriate privacy official; and
label: BODY

text: (4)  Using, disclosing, or requesting individually-identifiable information to the minimum
label: BODY

text: amount necessary required to perform their specific job function and to accomplish the intended
label: BODY

text: purpose of the use, disclosure, or request.
label: BODY

text: 5.  REFERENCES
label: HH1

text: a.  Title 38 U.S.C. 5701.
label: BODY

text: b.  Title 38 U.S.C. 5705.
label: BODY

text: c.  Title 38 U.S.C. 7332.
label: BODY

text: VHA DIRECTIVE 1605
label: HH1

text: March 17, 2005
label: HH1

text: d.  Title 38 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) §§1.500-527.
label: BODY

text: i.  Title 45 CFR, Parts 160 and 164.
label: BODY

text: j.  Public Law 104-191.
label: BODY

text: k.  Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-130, Appendix I.
label: BODY

text: l.  VA Directive 6502
label: BODY

text: 6.  DEFINITIONS
label: HH1

text: a.  Compliance.  For the purpose of this Directive, the term “compliance” means the act of
label: BODY

text: complying with policies, procedures, directives, laws, and other legal guidance.
label: BODY

text: b.  Individually-Identifiable Information.  Individually-identifiable information is any
label: BODY

text: information, including health information maintained by VHA, pertaining to an individual that
label: BODY

text: also identifies the individual and, except for individually-identifiable health information, is
label: BODY

text: retrieved by the individual’s name or other unique identifier.  Individually-identifiable health
label: BODY

text: information is covered regardless of whether or not the information is retrieved by name.
label: BODY

text: c.  Personnel.  For the purpose of this Directive, the term “personnel” includes those
label: BODY

text: officers and employees of the Department; consultants and attending clinicians; without
label: BODY

text: compensation (WOC) employees; contractors; others employed on a fee basis; medical students
label: BODY

text: and other trainees; and volunteer workers rendering uncompensated services, excluding patient
label: BODY

text: volunteers, providing a service at the direction of VA staff.  NOTE:  Compensated Work
label: BODY

text: Therapy (CWT) workers are not VHA personnel; they are patients receiving active treatment or
label: BODY

text: therapy.
label: BODY

text: d.  VHA Privacy Program.  The VHA Privacy Program is the effort within VHA to
label: BODY

text: establish and implement privacy policies and practices that comply with the requirements of all
label: BODY

text: applicable Federal privacy laws and regulations, VA regulations and VA privacy policies.  The
label: BODY

text: VHA Privacy Program at a minimum should address privacy policies, privacy training, use and
label: BODY

text: disclosure of information, individual’s privacy rights, privacy complaints, notice of privacy
label: BODY

text: practices and privacy compliance monitoring.
label: BODY
